page.title: 185, Coombe Street.
page.content: Typical of the houses in Bruton is 5, Coombe Street, which was built in 1686, on land owned by the Berkeley family. In the 18th century, the land ownership passed to the Hoare family. In 1798, the house, together with No. 3 and what is now The Tower House, was purchased by the Clarke family. All three properties were to remain in their hands until the death of Miss Jane Clarke in 1940. To the rear of the property is the remains of another cottage, with attached stable, that was demolished about 50 years ago. In the early 1950's, No. 5 was rebuilt internally, with the loss of about 10 feet to No. 3. A passageway through No. 5 contains some very old beams. In 1982, No. 5 was named {Maypole {Cottage,}since it and the outbuildings to the rear had originally been part of the Maypole Inn, closed in 1798.
